Package javelin.model.unit.condition

Class Condition

  • java.lang.Object
    • javelin.model.unit.condition.Condition
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable, java.lang.Comparable<Condition>, Cloneable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AbilityDamage, Barkskin.BarkskinCondition, BearsEndurance.Enduring, Bless.Blessed, Bluff.Feigned, Breathless, BullsStrength.Strong, CatsGrace.Graceful, Charging, Darkvision.DarkvisionCondition, Defending, DefensiveAttack.DefensiveStance, Displacement.Blinking, DominateMonster.Dominated, EaglesSplendor.Splendid, Fatigued, Feint.Feigned, FindTraps.FindingTraps, Fly.Flying, FoxsCunning.Cunning, GenericBuff, Grapple.Grappling, Heroic, Longstrider.Strider, Melding, NeutralizePoison.Neutralized, OwlsWisdom.Wise, Paralyzed, Poisoned, Prone, Rage.Raging, ResistEnergy.Resistant, Shaken, Sickened, StingOfTheAsp.AspString, StingOfTheRattler.RattlerSting, Stunned, TearingFang.Bleeding, TemporarySpell, VampiricTouch.Vampiric
    public abstract class Condition
extends java.lang.Object
implements Cloneable, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<Condition>
    A condition is a temporary effect on a Combatant.
    See Also:
    Combatant.conditions, Serialized Form

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      static class  Condition.Effect
      Buff means an effect is benefitial while debuff means it's a penalty.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      java.lang.Integer casterlevel

      Condition.Effect effect  
      float expireat
      AP at which this effect will wear off.
      java.lang.Integer longterm
      The number of hours for this to persist after battle.
      boolean stack
      If true, allows multiple instances of this condition to affect the same Combatant - otherwise, will merge(Combatant, Condition) them instead.

    • Field Detail

      • expireat

        public float expireat
        AP at which this effect will wear off. Use Float.MAX_VALUE to make it permanent for the duration of battle.

      • effect

        public Condition.Effect effect
        See Also:
        Condition.Effect

      • description

        public java.lang.String description
        Short description.

      • longterm

        public java.lang.Integer longterm
        The number of hours for this to persist after battle. If null will call end(Combatant) at the end of combat if it hasn't experired before that. If 0 will stop at the end of combat but end(Combatant) will affect the original Combatant instead of the clone used for the Fight. Subclasses that wish to implement their own expire(int, Combatant) mechanisms can pass Integer.MAX_VALUE here.
        See Also:
        Fight.originalblueteam

      • casterlevel

        public java.lang.Integer casterlevel
        null if this is not magical and can't be affected by DispelMagic.

      • stack

        public boolean stack
        If true, allows multiple instances of this condition to affect the same Combatant - otherwise, will merge(Combatant, Condition) them instead.

      • start

        public abstract void start​(Combatant c)

      • expireinbattle

        public boolean expireinbattle​(Combatant c)
        In-battle check if a Condition has expired.
        Returns:
        true if has expired and has been removed.
        See Also:
        expireat

      • end

        public abstract void end​(Combatant c)
        Removes all effects of this condition from Combatant. This may be called during battle, right after battle or at a later point depending on the values of expireat and longterm.

      • equals

        public boolean equals​(java.lang.Object obj)
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object

      • hashCode

        public int hashCode()
        Overrides:
        hashCode in class java.lang.Object

        public void finish​(BattleState s)

        Specified by:
        clone in interface Cloneable
        Overrides:
        clone in class java.lang.Object

      • transfer

        public void transfer​(Combatant from,
                     Combatant to)
        Migrates a temporary condition to the original Combatant instance outside of battle. start(Combatant) is not called again but this Condition is transferred to the original Combatant.
        Parameters:
        to - The original combatant.

      • terminate

        public void terminate​(int time,
                      Combatant c)
        This is called one or more times, eventually calling Combatant.removecondition(Condition) (and thus end(Combatant)) once longterm decreases to zero or less.
        Parameters:
        time - Elapsed time in hours.

      • expire

        protected boolean expire​(int time,
                         Combatant c)
        Expire out of battle.
        Parameters:
        c -
        Time - elapsed, in hours.
        Returns:
        true if is over and has to be removed.
        See Also:
        longterm

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object

      • dispel

        public void dispel()
        This is called when a condition is removed by DispelMagic, mostly as a way to prevent negative effects from happening in end(Combatant), when applicable. See Poisoned as an example.

      • validate

        public boolean validate​(Combatant c)
        Returns:
        If false, will discard this condition.

      • merge

        public void merge​(Combatant c,
                  Condition condition)
        Merge two conditions of the same type, as long as they don't stack. By the time this is called, validate(Combatant) has already been verified. The default implementation just extends the previous condition to whichever expireat is higher between both.
        Parameters:
        condition - Condition to be merged. Will be discarded afterwards.

      • compareTo

        public int compareTo​(Condition c)
        Specified by:
        compareTo in interface java.lang.Comparable<Condition>
